## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi, I have a few questions about VerusIDs and currencies. Can I create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name without any issues?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, no, you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name without any issues. This is because the protocol does not prevent making an ID with an i-address as its name, but it will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. The advice is to avoid doing this to prevent user confusion.

**User:**
Got it, thanks for the clarification. Another question: Can I use the same named currencies as a PBaaS chain in the Verus Desktop, even if they are already supported currencies like BTC or ETH?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you cannot use the same named currencies as a PBaaS chain in the Verus Desktop if they are already supported currencies like BTC or ETH. This is a limitation in the current testnet release, but it will be resolved before mainnet availability.

**User:**
That's good to know. I've also been wondering, do I need to delete any directories after updating to the new testnet release?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, if you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this, you need to delete the following directories before running this new update: `~/.komodo/vrsctest` on Linux, `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest` on MacOS, and `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST` on Windows.
Can I create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name without any issues?

No, you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name without any issues. This is because the protocol does not prevent making an ID with an i-address as its name, but it will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. The advice is to avoid doing this to prevent user confusion.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
```# Disclaimer
Can I use the same named currencies as a PBaaS chain in the Verus Desktop, even if they are already supported currencies like BTC or ETH?

No, you cannot use the same named currencies as a PBaaS chain in the Verus Desktop if they are already supported currencies like BTC or ETH. This is a limitation in the current testnet release, but it will be resolved before mainnet availability.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain.
